verses.verse: Now<WG1161> concerning<WG4012> the collection<WG3048> for<WG1519> the saints<WG40>, as<WG5618> I have given order<WG1299> to the churches<WG1577> of Galatia<WG1053>, even<WG2532> so<WG3779> do<WG4160> ye<WG5210>.

Upon<WG2596> the first<WG1520> day of the week<WG4521> let every one<WG1538> of you<WG5216> lay<WG5087> by<WG3844> him<WG1438> in store<WG2343>, as<WG5100><WG99999> God hath prospered him<WG2137>, that<WG2443> there be<WG1096> no<WG3361> gatherings<WG3048> when<WG5119><WG99999> I come<WG2064>.

And<WG1161> when<WG3752> I come<WG3854>, whomsoever<WG3739><WG99999> ye shall approve<WG1381> by<WG1223> your letters<WG1992>, them<WG5128> will I send<WG3992> to bring<WG667> your<WG5216> liberality<WG5485> unto<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2419>.
And<WG1161> if<WG1437> it be<WG5600> meet<WG514> that I go<WG4198> also<WG2504>, they shall go<WG4198> with<WG4862> me<WG1698>.
Now<WG1161> I will come<WG2064> unto<WG4314> you<WG5209>, when<WG3752> I shall pass through<WG1330> Macedonia<WG3109>: for<WG1063> I do pass through<WG1330> Macedonia<WG3109>.

And<WG1161> it may be that<WG5177> I will abide<WG3887>, yea<WG2228>, and<WG2532> winter<WG3914> with<WG4314> you<WG5209>, that<WG2443> ye<WG5210> may bring<WG4311> me<WG3165> on my journey<WG4311> whithersoever<WG3757><WG99999> I go<WG4198>.

For<WG1063> I will<WG2309> not<WG3756> see<WG1492> you<WG5209> now<WG737> by<WG1722> the way<WG3938>; but<WG1161> I trust<WG1679> to tarry<WG1961><WG99999> a while<WG5550> with<WG4314> you<WG5209>, if<WG1437> the Lord<WG2962> permit<WG2010>.
But<WG1161> I will tarry<WG1961> at<WG1722> Ephesus<WG2181> until<WG2193> Pentecost<WG4005>.
For<WG1063> a great<WG3173> door<WG2374> and<WG2532> effectual<WG1756> is opened unto<WG455> me<WG3427>, and<WG2532> there are many<WG4183> adversaries<WG480>.

Now<WG1161> if<WG1437> Timotheus<WG5095> come<WG2064>, see<WG991> that<WG2443> he may be<WG1096> with<WG4314> you<WG5209> without fear<WG870>: for<WG1063> he worketh<WG2038> the work<WG2041> of the Lord<WG2962>, as<WG5613> I<WG1473> also do<WG2532>.

Let<WG1848> no<WG3361> man<WG5100> therefore<WG3767> despise<WG1848> him<WG846>: but<WG1161> conduct<WG4311> him<WG846> forth<WG4311> in<WG1722> peace<WG1515>, that<WG2443> he may come<WG2064> unto<WG4314> me<WG3165>: for<WG1063> I look for<WG1551> him<WG846> with<WG3326> the brethren<WG80>.

As<WG1161> touching<WG4012> our brother<WG80> Apollos<WG625>, I<WG3870> greatly<WG4183> desired<WG3870> him<WG846> to<WG2443> come<WG2064> unto<WG4314> you<WG5209> with<WG3326> the brethren<WG80>: but<WG2532> his will<WG2307> was<WG2258> not<WG3756> at all<WG3843> to<WG2443> come<WG2064> at this time<WG3568>; but<WG1161> he will come<WG2064> when<WG3752> he shall have convenient time<WG2119>.
Watch ye<WG1127>, stand fast<WG4739> in<WG1722> the faith<WG4102>, quit you like men<WG407>, be strong<WG2901>.
Let<WG1096> all<WG3956> your<WG5216> things<WG3956> be done<WG1096> with<WG1722> charity<WG26>.

I beseech<WG3870> you<WG5209>, brethren<WG80>, (ye know<WG1492> the house<WG3614> of Stephanas<WG4734>, that<WG3754> it is<WG2076> the firstfruits<WG536> of Achaia<WG882>, and<WG2532> that they have addicted<WG5021> themselves<WG1438> to<WG1519> the ministry<WG1248> of the saints<WG40>,)
That<WG2443><WG99999> ye<WG5210> submit yourselves<WG5293> unto such<WG5108>, and<WG2532> to every one<WG3956> that<WG3588> helpeth with<WG4903> us<WG2532>, and laboureth<WG2872>.

I am glad of<WG5463> the coming<WG3952> of Stephanas<WG4734> and<WG2532> Fortunatus<WG5415> and<WG2532> Achaicus<WG883>: for that<WG3754> which<WG3588> was lacking<WG5303> on<WG1909> your part<WG5216> they<WG3778> have supplied<WG378>.
For<WG1063> they have refreshed<WG373> my<WG1699> spirit<WG4151> and<WG2532> yours<WG5216>: therefore<WG3767> acknowledge ye<WG1921> them that<WG3588> are such<WG5108>.

The churches<WG1577> of Asia<WG773> salute<WG782> you<WG5209>. Aquila<WG207> and<WG2532> Priscilla<WG4252> salute<WG782> you<WG5209> much<WG4183> in<WG1722> the Lord<WG2962>, with<WG4862> the church<WG1577> that is in<WG2596> their<WG846> house<WG3624>.
All<WG3956> the brethren<WG80> greet<WG782> you<WG5209>. Greet ye<WG782> one another<WG240> with<WG1722> an holy<WG40> kiss<WG5370>.
The salutation<WG783> of<WG3972> me Paul<WG3972> with my own<WG1699> hand<WG5495>.
If<WG1487> any man<WG5100> love<WG5368> not<WG3756> the Lord<WG2962> Jesus<WG2424> Christ<WG5547>, let him be<WG2277> Anathema<WG331> Maranatha<WG3134>.
The grace<WG5485> of our Lord<WG2962> Jesus<WG2424> Christ<WG5547> be with<WG3326> you<WG5216>.

My<WG3450> love<WG26> be with<WG3326> you<WG5216> all<WG3956> in<WG1722> Christ<WG5547> Jesus<WG2424>. Amen<WG2881>. The first epistle to the Corinthians was written from Philippi by Stephanas, and Fortunatus, and Achaicus, and Timotheus.
